getCopyrightMessage

public static java.lang.String getCopyrightMessage()

getTagFromPropertyString

public static int getTagFromPropertyString(java.lang.String value)
Returns the tag described by a given value. If the value starts with the '$' character it is a reference by name, if it starts with '@' it is a reference by group/element.

Parameters:
value - the property value.
Returns:
the tag. 0, if value does not begin with '$' or '@'. -1, if unknown tag.

getTagStringOrValue

public static java.lang.String getTagStringOrValue(java.lang.String value,
                                                   org.dcm4che.data.Dataset ds)
Returns the given value or, if it is a "Tag String", the contents of the tag. Tag Strings are value starts wich start with the '$' character it is a reference by name or with '@' if it is a reference by group/element.

Parameters:
value - the property value.
ds - the dataset to analyse.
Returns:
the value or content of tag. null, if unknown tag.

addPatientDirectory

public static java.io.File addPatientDirectory(java.io.File parent,
                                               org.dcm4che.data.Dataset ds)
Adds a subdirectory to a given path. The name of the subdirectory is composed of the patients name followed by '_' followed by the birthdate.

Parameters:
parent - the parent directory.
ds - the dataset to analyse.
Returns:
the composed directory.

uriToFile

public static java.io.File uriToFile(java.lang.String uriString)
Create a File from an URI. file-uri
Describes a file in a operating-system independend way. See the API-Doc of the URI class. For Windows-OS the absolute URI "file:/c:/user/tom/foo.txt" describes the file "C:\\user\\tom\\foo.txt". Relative URI's, e.g. without the "file:" schema-prefix, are relativ to the user-directory, given by the system property user.dir. For example: If the user.dir is "C:\\user\\tom\\" and the relative URI is "/abc/foo.txt" the referenced file is "C:\\user\\tom\\abc\\foo.txt". The abbreviations "." for the current and ".." for the upper directory are valid to form a relative URI.

Parameters:
uriString - The string-description of an absolute or relative URI.
Returns:
The file which is described by the uriString. Returns null, if uriString is null or "". Returns null also, if a conversion error occures.

datasetToTreeFileID

public static java.lang.String datasetToTreeFileID(org.dcm4che.data.Dataset ds)
Builds a file ID from the given Dataset. Components are separated by the '/' caharcter:
1. componet: First letter of famely name followed by first letter of given name followed by date of birth, 6 character. Example: TH570522
2. componet: Study date, 6 character. Example: 043012
3. componet: Modality, 2 character followed by study time, 4 character. Example: MR1531
4. componet: Study ID. Example: 4711
5. componet: Series number. Example: 3
6. componet: Instance number. Example: 54
All components are compatible to DICOM part 12, e.g. they have a maximum of 8 characters and consists of upper case caracters, numbers or '_'.

Parameters:
ds - the dataset to analyse.
Returns:
the file ID as a absolute pathString.

datasetToNameArray

public static java.lang.String[] datasetToNameArray(org.dcm4che.data.Dataset ds)
Builds an array of strings from the given Dataset:
[0]: First letter of famely name followed by first letter of given name followed by date of birth, 6 character. Example: TH570522
[1]: Study date, 6 character. Example: 043012
[2]: Modality, 2 character followed by study time, 4 character. Example: MR1531
[3]: Study ID. Example: 4711
[4]: Series number. Example: 3
[5]: Instance number. Example: 54
All components are compatible to DICOM part 12, e.g. they have a maximum of 8 characters and consists of upper case caracters, numbers or '_'.

Parameters:
ds - the dataset to analyse.
Returns:
the array of strings.

stringToFileIDComponentString

public static java.lang.String stringToFileIDComponentString(java.lang.String s)
Checks, if the given file ID is compatible to DICOM Part 12: It may only contain the characters 'A'..'Z','0'..'9' and '_'. The maximal length is 8 character. This method truncates the file ID after 8 characters, converts lower case to upper case characters and replaces all other not valid characters with the '_' character.

Parameters:
s - the file ID to check.
Returns:
the converted file ID.

wait

public static void wait(int sec)
Wait for a given amount of seconds.

Parameters:
sec - amount of seconds to wait.

uriToDataset

public static org.dcm4che.data.Dataset uriToDataset(java.lang.String uri)
                                             throws java.io.IOException
Loads a Dataset object from a URI. The URI references a file that must be conform to PS 3.10 - Media Storage and File Format for Media Interchange

Parameters:
uri - the URI referencing the Dataset.
Returns:
the read in Dataset.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - the exception is thrown, if 1. an input error occured during reading or 2. if a parsing error occured (in case of a non-DICOM file). In this case an DcmParseException is thrown, which is a subclass of IOException.

fileToDataset

public static org.dcm4che.data.Dataset fileToDataset(java.io.File f)
                                              throws java.io.IOException
Loads a Dataset object from a file. The file must be conform to PS 3.10 - Media Storage and File Format for Media Interchange

Parameters:
f - the file containing the Dataset.
Returns:
the read in Dataset.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - the exception is thrown, if 1. an input error occured during reading or 2. if a parsing error occured (in case of a non-DICOM file). In this case an DcmParseException is thrown, which is a subclass of IOException.
